Article Title: 'It doesn't take long for politicians ...': Jharkhand CM accuses BJP of poaching MLAs amid buzz over Champai Soren
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Jharkhand chief minister Hemant Soren on Sunday accused the Bharatiya Janata Party of attempting to 'poach' MLAs following former chief minister Champai Soren 's hints of quitting Jharkhand Mukti Morcha .Alleging that BJP has brought people from Gujarat, Assam and Maharashtra to divide social fabric in the state, Soren said," "Forget about society, these people work to break families and parties.""They poach MLAs.Money is such a thing that it doesn't take long for politicians to move here and there," he added.Hemant Soren's remarks came soon after Champai Soren said that “all three options” are open for him amid buzz over him joining the BJP.In an emotional post on social platform X, the Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) leader recalled the events right from the moment he took over as the chief minister of the state on February 2 to him being replaced by Hemant Soren, in whose absence he had led the government.Commenting on recent media reports about a rift within the JMM and the possibility of Champai Soren joining the BJP, the senior leader said, "After so much insult and contempt, I was forced to look for an alternative path. With a heavy heart, I said in a meeting of the legislative party that 'A new chapter of my life is going to start from today.' I had three options: First, to retire from politics; second, to form my own separate organization; and third, to continue if I found a companion on this path. From that day until the upcoming Jharkhand Assembly elections, all options remain open for me."Meanwhile, Hemant Soren also commented on the timing of Jharkhand’s assembly elections, and said that while they are due this year, the schedule would be "decided by the opposition party in the state, not by the Election Commission.""It seems the Election Commission is no longer a constitutional institution, as it has been occupied by BJP people," he said."I challenge them (BJP) that if the assembly elections are held today, they will be wiped out from Jharkhand tomorrow," he added.
Article Summary: Jharkhand chief minister Hemant Soren accused the Bharatiya Janata Party of attempting to 'poach' MLAs. His remarks came soon after former chief minister Champai Soren said that “all three options” are open for him amid buzz over him joining the BJP.

Article Title: Kolkata rape-murder case: Police summons BJP's Locket Chatterjee and 2 doctors for spreading rumours
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The Kolkata Police have summoned BJP leader Locket Chatterjee and two well-known doctors for allegedly spreading misinformation and revealing the identity of the woman doctor who was raped and murdered at R G Kar Medical College and Hospital , according to an officer.In addition to these three individuals, the police have also summoned 57 others for disseminating false information about the incident.Dr Kunal Sarkar and Dr Subarna Goswami were asked to appear before officers at the Kolkata Police Headquarters in Lalbazar at 3 pm on Sunday. These individuals have been accused of disclosing the victim's identity, spreading rumours, and sharing fake news.Dr Sarkar, a renowned cardiologist, confirmed receiving the summons from the police. He told PTI, "Yes, I have received the summons. But at the moment, I am out of town and have informed the Kolkata Police about that. I do not know why they have called me, but it seems that some of my comments on social media have elicited certain reactions nationally and internationally... maybe because of that."Dr Goswami, the deputy chief medical officer of Purba Bardhaman district, said he has not yet received the summons. He expressed his willingness to cooperate with the investigation, saying, "I am yet to receive anything. I do not know why Kolkata Police will issue summons to me when they are not investigating the case. I have been saying that I will cooperate with the probe in every possible manner. I didn't reveal the identity of the victim or spread any rumour."Moreover, Chatterjee said she has not received any summons yet. She commented, "It would have been better if they had shown the same promptness while investigating the case. Everyone wants justice for the girl."During a press conference on Friday, Kolkata Police commissioner Vineet Goyal mentioned that the extensive rumour-mongering has hindered their investigation and posed a threat to law and order.
Article Summary: Locket Chatterjee, Dr Kunal Sarkar and Dr Subarna Goswami were asked to appear before officers at the Kolkata Police Headquarters in Lalbazar at 3 pm on Sunday. These individuals have been accused of disclosing the victim's identity, spreading rumours, and sharing fake news. Dr Sarkar, a renowned cardiologist, confirmed receiving the summons.

Article Title: SC takes suo motu cognizance of Kolkata rape-murder case, bench led by CJI to hear matter on Aug 20
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The Supreme Court on Sunday took suo motu cognizance of the alleged rape and murder of a trainee doctor at RG Kar Hospital in Kolkata.A bench of Chief Justice of India DY Chandrachud and Justices JB Pardiwala and Manoj Misra will hear the case on August 20.The apex court's intervention comes after widespread outrage and strikes by doctors across the country, who are accusing the state police of mishandling the case.The Indian Medical Association (IMA), the largest organization of doctors in the country, has spearheaded the call for justice for the murdered doctor. On Saturday, the IMA organized a nationwide strike, halting all non-essential medical services for 24 hours.On Wednesday night, thousands of women across the country took to the streets to demand justice for the victim, joining "Reclaim The Night" marches.A postgraduate trainee doctor was raped and murdered at the RG Kar Medical College and Hospital in Kolkata while on duty last week.The semi-naked body of the 32-year-old woman was found on August 9 morning in the seminar hall of the government-run hospital in the West Bengal capital.A civic volunteer has been arrested in connection with the crime.The Calcutta High Court on Tuesday ordered the transfer of the probe into the case from the Kolkata Police to the Central Bureau of Investigation
Article Summary: A bench of Chief Justice of India DY Chandrachud and Justices JB Pardiwala and Manoj Misra will hear the case on August 20. A postgraduate trainee doctor was raped and murdered at the RG Kar Medical College and Hospital in Kolkata while on duty last week. A civic volunteer has been arrested in connection with the crime.

Article Title: Had to go with Ajit Pawar as my bank faced troubles: NCP MLA
Article Text: NAGPUR: NCP MLA Rajendra Shingne has claimed that due to troubles faced by a cooperative bank with which he was associated, he had to side with Maharashtra deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar after the party split last year. Ajit Pawar and several other MLAs joined the Shiv Sena-BJP government in the state last year, leading to a split in the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) founded by Sharad Pawar.Shingne on Saturday shared the dias with NCP (SP) chief Sharad Pawar at a programme in Wardha.Speaking to mediapersons on the sidelines of the programme, the MLA, representing Sindkhed Raja in Buldhana district, said he has always respected Sharad Pawar.Shingne said he worked under the leadership of Sharad Pawar for around 30 years and that the latter has made a huge contribution to his political career and he will always be indebted to him."However, of late, due to troubles faced by my district cooperative bank (in Buldhana) and helplessness, I had to go to them (ruling side) with Ajit Dada. Today, the district cooperative bank has received Rs 300 crore from the government. But certainly, Pawar saheb will always be venerable to me," Shingne said.
Article Summary: NCP MLA Rajendra Shingne shared the dias with NCP (SP) chief Sharad Pawar at a programme in Wardha. Ajit Pawar and several other MLAs joined the Shiv Sena-BJP government in the state last year.

Article Title: Bid to deprive 'PDA' of quota: Akhilesh Yadav
Article Text: Attacking the NDA government over the appointment of bureaucrats at the Centre through lateral entry, Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav Sunday said it is a part of BJP's conspiracy to deprive "PDA" (picchde, Dalit, alpsankhyak) of reservation benefits.He said lateral entry was BJP's channel to post "ideologically aligned" officers on high positions and it was time for a nationwide protest from October 2.PDA stands for backward classes, Dalits, and minorities who had voted in favour of the SP in Lok Sabha polls helping the party secure 37 seats in UP.
Article Summary: Akhilesh Yadav said lateral entry was BJP's channel to post "ideologically aligned" officers on high positions. PDA stands for backward classes, Dalits, and minorities who had voted in favour of SP in Lok Sabha polls helping the party secure 37 seats in UP.

Article Title: 'Towering figure': PM tribute to Karunanidhi on centenary
Article Text: CHENNAI: Prime Minister Narendra Modi led the tributes to former Tamil Nadu CM and DMK patriarch M Karunanidhi as the Centre released Sunday a commemorative coin marking the departed politician's centenary .In a letter to Karunanidhi's son and current CM M K Stalin, the PM praised the DMK stalwart, describing him as a "towering figure" in Indian politics, literature, and society.Modi's sentiments were shared in a post on platform X by Stalin, who expressed gratitude, saying: "I wholeheartedly thank Hon'ble Prime Minister Thiru. @narendramodi avl. for his kind wishes and support..."Stalin expressed pride in the national recognition of his father's legacy, saying: "I am happy that the entire country is celebrating Kalaignar through the centenary coin."Defence minister Rajnath Singh, who officially unveiled the coin at a ceremony in Chennai, remembered Karunanidhi as a national figure. "A man whose influence extended far beyond Tamil Nadu, Karunanidhi was a titan of Indian politics, a cultural stalwart, and a relentless advocate for social justice," Singh said.Congress MP Rahul Gandhi also paid tribute , highlighting Karunanidhi's progressive vision. "Kalaignar Karunanidhi's socially progressive vision and unwavering dedication to empowering people paved the way for millions to live a life of dignity," he said. He credited Karunanidhi's leadership for transforming Tamil Nadu.Earlier in the day, Singh and Stalin visited Karunanidhi's memorial at Marina Beach in Chennai. The ceremony also saw the attendance of BJP state president K Annamalai, who was seated in the front row.
Article Summary: PM Narendra Modi leads tributes to former Tamil Nadu CM and DMK patriarch M Karunanidhi. Centre releases commemorative coin marking the departed politician's centenary. Defence minister Rajnath Singh, who officially unveiled the coin at a ceremony in Chennai.

Article Title: Will go alone in assembly polls: J&K BJP chief Ravinder Raina
Article Text: JAMMU: BJP will not form any pre-poll alliance with other parties for the upcoming assembly elections in Jammu & Kashmir, state BJP chief Ravinder Raina said on Sunday.He said the party is in touch with 9-10 independent candidates in Kashmir valley. “If these discussions materialize, we will formulate a strategy to contest the polls together. BJP will announce the first list of candidates soon,” he said.Welcoming former state minister Zulfkar Ali into the party, Raina recalled that Ali had launched several development projects for the welfare of the people during his term in the cabinet.
Article Summary: State BJP chief Ravinder Raina said the party is in touch with 9-10 independent candidates in Kashmir valley. Raina welcomed former state minister Zulfkar Ali into the party. He recalled that Ali had launched several development projects for the welfare of the people during his term in the cabinet.

Article Title: Ex-minister, J&K Apni Party founder Zulfkar joins BJP ahead of polls
Article Text: JAMMU: Former J&K minister and a founding member of J&K Apni Party, Chowdhary Zulfkar Ali , joined the BJP on Sunday at the party headquarters in Jammu, close on the heels of election commission announcing assembly polls in J&K, starting September 18.Zulfkar was inducted by Union minister and BJP’s J&K assembly election in-charge G Kishan Reddy, BJP national general secretary Tarun Chugh, J&K BJP president Ravinder Raina and Union minister of state for PMO Jitendra Singh.On Saturday, he had met Union home minister Amit Shah in Delhi.Zulfkar said he joined BJP for the welfare of the ST community and the progress of Rajouri-Poonch area.“We remained part of the govt in J&K but always lived in fear. We were scared and in order to survive, we had to be part of National Conference,” Zulfkar said.He has been a cabinet minister in J&K from 2015 to 2018 and handled departments like food and civil supplies and tribal affairs.
Article Summary: Chowdhary Zulfkar Ali joined the BJP on Sunday at the party headquarters in Jammu. He was inducted by Union minister and BJP’s J&K assembly election in- charge G Kishan Reddy. He said he joined BJP for the welfare of the ST community and the progress of Rajouri-Poonch area.

Article Title: BJP failed to reciprocate the contribution of people from Jind in past 10 years: Kumari Selja
Article Text: CHANDIGARH: AICC general secretary and Lok Sabha MP from Sirsa Kumari Selja said on Sunday that the incumbent BJP government has not only failed in the state but has miserably failed to reciprocate to the contribution of people of Jind in the past ten years.The former union minister, who also holds the charge of Uttrakhand Congress said that Jind district is a revolutionary district, but it has not received what it deserved.Jind district has been subjected to discrimination. In the last ten years under the BJP government, Jind has seen more neglect than ever before.Accompanied by Rajya Sabha MP Randeep Surjewala , Mahila Congress president Sudha Bhardwaj and other senior Congress leaders, she was addressing a rally in Jind . Selja said that the BJP will have to account for its ten years in power.The BJP is making promises about MSP, but they should clarify what law they have made for MSP. She said that the BJP government has mistreated various sections of society, including Dalits, employees, backward classes, farmers, women, and traders. This is why all sections are angry with the BJP, and the public will take revenge on October 1 with the power of their votes.i Selja said that due to the BJP's anti-people mindset, there is an outcry among all 36 communities today. She said that scholarships have been stopped so that children cannot study, and there are scams in jobs. Youths are forced to go abroad for employment. She said that anyone who raises their voice for their rights is beaten with sticks. She urged the people that the time has come to get rid of such a government.The Rajya Sabha MP Randeep Singh Surjewala said that he was confident that Rahul Gandhi and Kharge will soon begin the battle for change in power in Haryana, starting from Jind. He said that Jind has faced discrimination in development under the BJP government. There has been no work done in the name of development. Crime has increased to such an extent that people are living in an atmosphere of fear. Government job exams are being sold, which is why the youth do not see a bright future and are moving abroad.
Article Summary: AICC general secretary and Lok Sabha MP from Sirsa Kumari Selja said on Sunday that the incumbent BJP government has not only failed in the state but has miserably failed to reciprocate to the contribution of people of Jind. She said that scholarships have been stopped so that children cannot study and there are scams in jobs.

Article Title: Teen dies after AC outdoor unit falls on him
Article Text:
(With inputs from agencies)

NEW DELHI: Videos circulating online on Sunday shows how an 18-year-old boy lost his life, and his 17-year-old friend sustained injuries when an air conditioner's outdoor unit fell on them from a building's second floor, in a tragic incident in Central Delhi the previous day.The video footage shows the victim, Jitesh , sitting on a scooter in the Doriwalan area at around 7 pm on Saturday, talking with his friend Pranshu , when an AC outdoor unit detached from a building and fell on the two friends, injuring both of them.The victims were rushed to a nearby medical facility, where the doctors pronounced Jitesh dead upon his arrival. Pranshu, however, was admitted for further treatment, which is currently undergoing and is unfit for statement."On Saturday, at around 7 pm, information regarding the falling of an AC outdoor unit on a person was received at Desh Bandhu Road police station. The unit fell on two boys from the second floor," a police official said."The forensic team has examined the scene and further investigation is in progress," he addedFollowing the incident, an official complaint was filed, citing sections 125(a) (act endangering life or personal safety of others) and 106 (causing death by negligence) of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, the officer confirmed.Police are investigating the incident, further details are awaited
Article Summary: An 18-year-old boy lost his life when an air conditioner's outdoor unit fell on them from a building's second floor. Video footage shows the victim, Jitesh, sitting on a scooter in the Doriwalan area at around 7 pm on Saturday.

Article Title: Maharashtra assembly elections: Will back any Congress & NCP(SP) CM candidate, says Uddhav Thackeray
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Former Maharashtra chief minister Uddhav Thackeray on Friday expressed his willingness to support any candidate put forward by the Congress and NCP(SP) as the Maha Vikas Aghadi 's (MVA) chief ministerial face for the upcoming state elections.While addressing Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) cadres, Uddhav emphasised that Maharashtra assembly elections will be a fight to protect self-respect of the state."Let's decide the CM face of Maha Vikas Aghadi, I will support it. Let Congress, NCP-SCP suggest their CM face, I will support it because we have to work for the betterment of Maharashtra and I want to give a reply to these '50 khokas' & 'gaddar' that people want us, not you," Uddhav said.Drawing from his past experience of forming an alliance with the BJP, Uddhav said that the chief ministerial candidate should be determined in advance, rather than by the principle of the party that secures the most seats in the elections."After our experience of alliance with BJP, we are of the view that we should not follow the policy of CM post for party with the most number of MLAs in the alliance. In several past elections, with an alliance with BJP, we have experienced that to make maximum number of MLAs, parties themselves try to put their other allies' candidates down. So I will not be in favour that the party with the most number of MLAs should get the CM post," he said.Uddhav Thackeray urged the Maha Vikas Aghadi cadres to act as representatives of the opposition alliance in the state. The Maharashtra assembly elections are expected to take place in October or November. The MVA consists of the Sena (UBT), Sharad Pawar-led NCP (SP), and Congress.
Article Summary: Former Maharashtra chief minister Uddhav Thackeray expressed his willingness to support any candidate put forward by the Congress and NCP(SP) as the Maha Vikas Aghadi's chief ministerial face. The Maharashtra assembly elections are expected to take place in October or November. The MVA consists of the Sena, Sharad Pawar-led NCP (SP), and Congress.
